body_html:
These are both fixed on master.

The first one does not error out, while the second one has the following (nice) error message:

In [14]: torch.cat([torch.Tensor(2,3),Variable(torch.Tensor(2,3)).cuda()],0)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-14-3275f4796029> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.cat([torch.Tensor(2,3),Variable(torch.Tensor(2,3)).cuda()],0)

RuntimeError: Expected a Tensor of type torch.FloatTensor but found a type torch.cuda.FloatTensor for
 sequence element 1  in sequence argument at position #1 'tensors'

body:
These are both fixed on master.

The first one does not error out, while the second one has the following (nice) error message:
```
In [14]: torch.cat([torch.Tensor(2,3),Variable(torch.Tensor(2,3)).cuda()],0)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-14-3275f4796029> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.cat([torch.Tensor(2,3),Variable(torch.Tensor(2,3)).cuda()],0)

RuntimeError: Expected a Tensor of type torch.FloatTensor but found a type torch.cuda.FloatTensor for
 sequence element 1  in sequence argument at position #1 'tensors'
```
